@vjpai The only way to assure that is using `__attribute__((aligned(cache_line_size))` which I debated adding. Manual padding works across platforms, but the aligned attribute only works on `clang` and `gcc`. My understanding was manual padding is preferred in gRPC. If that's not the case, I'm happy to add the aligned attribute. It's actually easier for me :-) Please just let me know.

```
Corrupt JSON data (indicates timeout or crash): 
    bm_call_create.BM_IsolatedFilter_ClientChannelFilter_NoOp_.counters.new: 10
    bm_call_create.BM_IsolatedFilter_ClientChannelFilter_NoOp_.counters.old: 10


[microbenchmarks] Performance differences noted:
Benchmark                                                                   cpu_time    real_time
--------------------------------------------------------------------------  ----------  -----------
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/16777216/16777216  -10%        -10%
```
Thank you @vjpai That makes sense. I liked the union idea, it works and it's not fragile. I'm trying that now. :-)
@vjpai Please take another look. thank you for the suggestion.
